medicinalProduct.name: Humalog
sourceSections: SmPC 4.2 Posology and method of administration
SmPC 4.4 Special warnings and precautions for use

onset.description: Humalog takes effect rapidly and is intended to be injected very close to mealtime.
leafletTextSnippets: Humalog works very quickly and lasts a shorter time than soluble insulin (2 to 5 hours). You should normally use Humalog within 15 minutes of a meal.

peak.description: Rapid rise in serum insulin with peak levels reached around 30–70 minutes after injection.
leafletTextSnippets: Peak blood levels of insulin lispro are reached 30 to 70 minutes after subcutaneous injection.

duration.description: Short duration of action compared with soluble human insulin.
leafletTextSnippets: Humalog works very quickly and lasts a shorter time than soluble insulin (2 to 5 hours).

timeEffectNotes.note: Because it is rapid-acting, hypoglycaemia – if it occurs – may appear earlier after injection compared with soluble human insulin.
timeEffectNotes.leafletTextSnippet: A consequence of the pharmacodynamics of rapid-acting insulin analogues is that if hypoglycaemia occurs, it may occur earlier after an injection when compared with soluble human insulin.

increaseDoseFactors.reason: Stress hormones during illness or infection tend to increase blood glucose levels and insulin requirements.
increaseDoseFactors.timeEffectAnnotation: ↑ overall insulin need throughout the day; may require higher pre-meal Humalog doses to keep glucose in range.

increaseDoseFactors.reason: Stress can increase counter-regulatory hormones, raising blood glucose.
increaseDoseFactors.timeEffectAnnotation: ↑ insulin demand; same time–action curve but more units are needed at meals and possibly correction doses.
increaseDoseFactors.leafletTextSnippet: Insulin requirements may be increased during illness or emotional disturbances.

increaseDoseFactors.factor: Chronic hepatic impairment leading to insulin resistance
increaseDoseFactors.reason: In chronic liver disease, insulin resistance can develop and increase insulin requirements.
increaseDoseFactors.timeEffectAnnotation: May blunt expected glucose fall after Humalog; peak effect may appear ‘smaller’ rather than later.
increaseDoseFactors.leafletTextSnippet: In chronic hepatic impairment, an increase in insulin resistance may lead to increased insulin requirements.

decreaseDoseFactors.reason: Reduced renal function can decrease insulin clearance, lowering insulin requirements.
decreaseDoseFactors.timeEffectAnnotation: Humalog action may be more pronounced and prolonged; risk of earlier and prolonged hypoglycaemia.
decreaseDoseFactors.leafletTextSnippet: Insulin requirements may be reduced in patients with renal impairment.

decreaseDoseFactors.reason: Reduced hepatic gluconeogenesis lowers glucose output; insulin requirements can fall.
decreaseDoseFactors.timeEffectAnnotation: Greater glucose-lowering effect for the same dose; higher risk of hypoglycaemia especially around the expected peak.
decreaseDoseFactors.leafletTextSnippet: Insulin requirements may be reduced in patients with hepatic impairment due to reduced capacity for gluconeogenesis and reduced insulin metabolism.

decreaseDoseFactors.reason: Exercise increases insulin sensitivity and glucose uptake in muscles.
decreaseDoseFactors.timeEffectAnnotation: Can effectively ‘amplify’ and slightly prolong Humalog’s effect after the injection; hypoglycaemia may appear earlier and/or be more pronounced.
decreaseDoseFactors.leafletTextSnippet: Exercise taken immediately after a meal may increase the risk of hypoglycaemia.

decreaseDoseFactors.factor: Reduced food intake / delayed or missed meal
decreaseDoseFactors.reason: Less carbohydrate available while a rapid-acting insulin is active increases risk of low blood glucose.
decreaseDoseFactors.timeEffectAnnotation: No change in time to peak, but the same Humalog dose acts on less glucose → earlier and deeper hypoglycaemia risk.
decreaseDoseFactors.leafletTextSnippet: Inadequate dosing or discontinuation, especially in insulin-requiring diabetes, may lead to hyperglycaemia… Conversely, too high a dose, missed meals, or increased activity can lead to hypoglycaemia.

otherRelevantFactors.factor: Change in injection site (especially from lipohypertrophy / cutaneous amyloidosis to a healthy site)
otherRelevantFactors.reason: Switching away from sites with lipodystrophy/amyloidosis can suddenly increase insulin absorption.
otherRelevantFactors.timeEffectAnnotation: Faster and stronger fall in glucose than expected at the same time points → earlier hypoglycaemia after injection.
otherRelevantFactors.leafletTextSnippet: There is a potential risk of delayed insulin absorption and worsened glycaemic control following insulin injections at sites with these reactions… A sudden change in the injection site to an unaffected area has been reported to result in hypoglycaemia.

mealTiming.recommendedWindow: within 15 minutes before the meal; if necessary, shortly after starting the meal
mealTiming.timeEffectAnnotation: Humalog is designed to match the post-meal glucose rise; injecting significantly earlier or without eating shifts the time–action curve away from the glucose curve, increasing hypoglycaemia risk.
